nl.strohalm.cyclos.services.stats

Interface StatisticalService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Service
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    StatisticalActivityService, StatisticalActivityServiceLocal, StatisticalFinancesService, StatisticalFinancesServiceLocal, StatisticalKeyDevelopmentsService, StatisticalKeyDevelopmentsServiceLocal, StatisticalServiceLocal, StatisticalTaxesService, StatisticalTaxesServiceLocal
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StatisticalActivityServiceImpl, StatisticalActivityServiceSecurity, StatisticalFinancesServiceImpl, StatisticalFinancesServiceSecurity, StatisticalKeyDevelopmentsServiceImpl, StatisticalKeyDevelopmentsServiceSecurity, StatisticalServiceImpl, StatisticalServiceSecurity, StatisticalTaxesServiceImpl, StatisticalTaxesServiceSecurity

    public interface StatisticalService
extends Service
    Service interface for common Statistics. This interface is extended for the different categories of statistics (key developments, activity, etc)
    Author:
    rinke

    • Field Detail

      • MINIMUM_NUMBER_OF_VALUES

        static final int MINIMUM_NUMBER_OF_VALUES
        Minimum number of data values required to generate statistics.

        Policy in cases of limited amount of data:

        • Medians will only be calculated if N >= this field.
        • p-values will only be calculated if both N's are bigger than or equal to this field (so: AND)
        • complete graphs and tables will not be shown if all N's are too small (smaller than this value).
        • one point in the graph or table will not be shown normally if N < this field. In graphs, it will be shown as 0; in tables, it will be shown as "-".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ALPHA

        static final double ALPHA
        The level on which is tested. This means that all p-values in statistics will be on this level, and all confidence intervals will be on the (1 - alpha) level. By default this is 0.05
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • setMaximumDataPoints

        void setMaximumDataPoints(int maximumDataPoints)
        sets the maximum number of datapoints which the user can request. A datapoint is one statistical calculation via sql. The default value is 1000. Set this from the prepareForm method in the action, and only if you want another maximum than the default of 1000.
        Parameters:
        maximumDataPoints -

      • validate

        void validate(java.lang.Object query)
